website_summaries.verdict: This affordable wetsuit is flexible and easy to get on and off.
pros: Shoulder and knee pads protect high wear areas
Extra-long leash makes it easy to get in and out of quickly
Stretch panels ensure  the suit will fit comfortably
Flat stitching is comfortable enough to wear all day
cons: Not suitable for water temperatures below 65 degrees

customer_reviews.title: 6'8" 240lbs/ 36"x36" pant size/ XLT shirts
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'8" and 240lbs. I bought the 5xl. It fits as well as I could expect for a suit that is this cheap. I have used mine about 50 times from diving to surfing and it still looks brand new. I rinse it every time I use it with freshwater. It is a little loose around my neck but otherwise it fits decently well. I have long legs and a long torso and the only thing I would change on the suit would be a little longer torso. Otherwise the arms and legs are plenty long.
customer_reviews.author: brent

customer_reviews.title: I was able to shift it all down and fold into my ankles like a cuff
customer_reviews.text: Affordable suit for keeping warm in coooler water. Women's sizing favors taller gals. I am 5'2 and full figured. Had some gaps at the knee and waist. I was able to shift it all down and fold into my ankles like a cuff. Worked well for cold waters in the Galapagos. Good arm action-stretchy pits. Was glad to have it after seeing (and smelling) some of the shoddy rental suits on our tours. It packed up tight. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for myself and one for my wife, I'm 6' 2 190 pounds and went with the XL. Fit was great the only dead space was in the arms from super long sleeves. My wife is 5' 4 140 pounds and she got a size 7 which worked out great with only some dead space in the arms as well. They are comfortable and for the price seem to be great quality. I would say you're probably OK to about 70 degree water in these, some people might say you could do a little colder but that's where I'm putting it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamez Dean

customer_reviews.title: Quality of the wetsuite was good when it arrive, but in few month is completely disintegrated
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the wetsuite was good when it arrive, 4 month use suit start to fall appart, customer care department is "great" first few emails went unanswered, and when they decided to write back they just told me to go on their site and read return policy! "Thanks" Please see new pics.
customer_reviews.author: Prvt15

customer_reviews.title: Excellent suit for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable suit. I have not been able to test it yet, but I tried it on and it fits like a glove. The sizing chart is a bit off. I am 6'4, and roughly 215 lbs, and I went with an XL. It fits perfectly. It's a little snug around the groin, but my height mostly comes from my legs. Can't wait to test it out!
customer_reviews.author: TraceWindu

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit and true to size
customer_reviews.text: Great Fit and true to size. Very comfortable when swimming laps in cooler water when air temperature dipped below 50
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: They was absolutely perfect. We dove with a lady who used a ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from the Caribbean and used these. They was absolutely perfect. We dove with a lady who used a 1mm suite and she was freezing while we was completely comfortable. I'm 5'10" weighing 195 lbs and went with an XL and it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'3" 150lb woman, wear size 8 pants. Got a size 9 It fit very well, he sleeves are a bit long, but for this price, it's great. As easy to get on and off as any other wetsuit. Rubber on the knee area is nice. Will try it out this weekend on a paddleboard , hopefully NOT in the 40 degree water.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap rip off
customer_reviews.text: They rate this as an "inexpective" wetsuit, but the fact of the matter is that it isn't a wet suit at all; it is a cheap rip-off. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: isisisis

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased (6'4", got 4XL size, fits great)
customer_reviews.text: Impressed - I'm 6'4" and I got the 4XL and it's a perfect (snug) fit. I'm a teeny bit soft around the middle (hey, I'm 45) and this is the ideal size for me; couldn't be better if it was custom fit. If you were a bit leaner it'd probably still work for you, but any taller/wider you should definitely go up a size. Height-wise (my biggest concern) it's perfection. Very comfortable, great freedom of movement, warm (not tried it in the water yet but it has all the wrist/neck/ankle seals you'd expect). Looks well made, not 'cheap' at all; neoprene is snug and comfortable and stretchy where you want it. Really a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Aplin

customer_reviews.title: xl is way to small, almost had to cut ...
customer_reviews.text: xl is way to small, almost had to cut myself out of it, I am 185 lbs with a 34 inch waist, order larger size,
customer_reviews.author: frank c. dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Sizing was off
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a good quality wetsuit, but the sizing was way off for me. I was at the high end for a size 9 (I'm almost 5 ft 8 and about 145 lbs, with a 36" bust and 40" hips), but it was quite a bit too big. Specifically, the legs, chest, and arms were all too large. I returned it and will be trying the 7, but I'm worried that will be too small. I recognize that wetsuits are hard to fit, but I am not atypically shaped and by their chart, the 9 should even have been a bit small. I think manufacturers need to offer a wider range of sizes.
customer_reviews.author: fictiongirl

customer_reviews.title: For the price awesome deal.
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a great deal. Even if you trash it once a year still an awesome deal. Also I'm 6'5'' and 275 a 4XL fit me best with a bit of extra length in the arms. Not to much.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Huff

product_meta.title: Seavenger Odyssey 3mm Neoprene Wetsuit
product_meta.description:
Durability That Lasts

Super-stretch panels around your knees and armpits make sure your wetsuit flexes where it should and doesn't lose its elasticity. Special knee pads and shoulder pads have anti-abrasion technology, making it perfect for water sports that require extra gear, like scuba diving and snorkeling. Whether you're an experienced diver or a beginner to wearing a wetsuit, this one lasts through the wear and tear.

Comfortable for All-Day Wear

Go right from snorkeling at the surface to diving in the deep; this 3mm neoprene full-body wetsuit forms to your body for maximum comfort and doesn't irritate your skin. 

Easy Donning & Doffing

An extra long leash and #10 YKK zipper makes it easy to slip into your wetsuit just before your dive or layer under other gear for cold-water activities.

 SIZING DISCLAIMER:

For best performance, Seavenger wetsuits are designed to fit very tightly to provide maximum insulation. A well-fitted wetsuit should allow the wearer to breathe normally and move with some effort but may feel slightly constricting.
feature_bullets: PREMIUM QUALITY — 3mm neoprene material is ideal for 65° F & up.
DURABLE AND COMFORTABLE — Comfortable flat-lock stitching and anti-abrasion shoulder and knee pads provide extra strength.
ULTRA FLEXIBLE — Super-stretch panels in the knee & armpit make it great for triathlon use.
EASY DONNING AND DOFFING — Extra long leash and a #10 YKK zipper for comfort and convenience.
SIZING RECOMMENDATION — These suits are meant to fit tightly to the body, please review Seavenger size chart to determine your perfect fit.
